page.title: 13People - Farms
page.content: The people living and working on the farms like the idea of living in the family house and farming land farmed by their ancestors, but all agree things have changed. It is more difficult to make a living as life styles have changed. There is not the demand for meat, overheads are higher, and the return on their capital has gone down. All agreed that the only way to get on was to work hard and live within your means. The use of a car and the ability to drive is most important as public transport is poor and the railway station some distance away at the other end of Church Fenton. The young people would like more public transport and entertainment but enjoy the privacy of country living. The most general complaint was of aeroplane noise especially at night.
